summary: Retrieves the details of a statement, including the transactions, which can be a standard order transaction, an adjustment transaction, or a reserve-related transaction
description:
Retrieves the details of a statement, including the transactions, which can be a standard order transaction, an adjustment transaction, or a reserve-related transaction. For the SKU-level details of an order transaction, refer to Get Transactions by Order.​ Applicable for all regions' sellers. Only data after 2023-07-01 is available (Please note that for US cross-border sellers, data before 2025-04-30 is unavailable).​ Version
202501
  
API Testing Tool
​

query.description: Use this property to pass shop information in requesting the API. Failure in passing the correct value when requesting the API for cross-border shops will return incorrect response. ​ Get by API Get Authorization Shop​
Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.​
An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Retrieve this value from the result of the next_page_token from a previous response. It is not needed for the first page.​
The returned results will be sorted by the specified field. Only supports order_create_time.​
The sort order for the sort_field parameter. ​ Default: ASC ​ Possible values:​ - ASC: Ascending order​ - DESC: Descending order​
The number of results to be returned per page. ​ Default: 20​ Valid range: [1-100]​
Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders. ​
Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.​

header.description: The seller access_token value from Get Access Token, when user_type = 0. Follow this guide to get seller access_token.​

schema.description: The success or failure status code returned in API response.​
The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.​

children.description: An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Provide this value in the page_token parameter of your request if the current response does not return all the results.​
The statement ID.​
The time when the statement was generated. Unix timestamp. ​ Statements are generated daily at 00:00 UTC.​ ​
The statement status. Only supports SETTLED.​
The three-digit currency code in ISO 4217 format. ​
The final amount paid out after accounting for reserve funds.​ Formula: total_settlement_amount + total_reserve_amount​

The total amount withheld from settlement based on TikTok Shop Reserve Policy. Refer to TikTok Shop Academy for more information.​ - A positive amount indicates the funds that have been released.​ - A negative amount indicates the funds being withheld from the settlement.​ ​ Applicable only for UK and US local sellers.​
The total settlement amount.​ ​ Formula: total_revenue_amount - total_shipping_cost_amount - total_fee_tax_amount - total_adjustment_amount​
The list of amounts that directly contribute to total_settlement_amount.​
The total revenue amount at the time of order settlement. This is equivalent to the net sales amount.​
The total shipping costs at the time of order settlement.​
The total fees and taxes charged by the platform at the time of order settlement. Shipping-related costs are excluded.​
The total adjustment amount based on TikTok Shop policy. ​ Refer to transactions.type for the list of adjustment-related policies.​
The number of transaction records in the statement.​
The list of transaction records in the statement. Each transaction corresponds to an order, an adjustment, or a reserve-related transaction.​
The transaction ID.​

The transaction type.​ ​ Standard transactions​ - ORDER: A transaction related to an order settlement.​ - RESERVE: A transaction involving collection or release of reserve funds.​ - If the transaction is an adjustment, it returns one of the following values:​ ​ Platform-related adjustments​ - CHARGE_BACK: Charges returned to a payment card after a customer has successfully disputed an item on their account statement or transactions report.​ - CUSTOMER_SERVICE_COMPENSATION: Extra compensation or compensation paid to a customer after the after-sales period by customer service.​ - DEDUCTIONS_INCURRED_BY_SELLER: Deduction arising from customer dissatisfaction as a result of the seller's responsibility. This includes issues such as fraud, empty packages, items that do not match the product display page, or items of lower value than advertised.​ - GMV_PAYMENT_FOR_ADS: Amount used to pay for your advertisement if you are enabled "auto pay ads with shop GMV", or to pay for Tiktok Promote ads orders.​ - PLATFORM_COMMISSION_ADJUSTMENT: Adjustment when there are differences in the platform commission paid by the seller.​ - PLATFORM_COMMISSION_COMPENSATION: Compensation paid to the seller when there are differences in the platform commission paid by the seller.​ - PLATFORM_PENALTY: Penalty imposed for a violation of TikTok Shop policies (the corresponding amount has been deducted from the seller's account). For details, please refer to the email notification sent to the seller.​ - PROMOTION_ADJUSTMENT: Adjustment when a seller takes part in a platform promotion and there are differences between the promotion price and the actual amount paid by the seller.​ - REBATE: A discount on referral fees offered by TikTok Shop to eligible sellers.​ - PLATFORM_COMPENSATION: Compensation paid to the seller after the seller successfully appealed for a customer dispute.​ - PLATFORM_REIMBURSEMENT: Reimbursement paid by TikTok Shop for an order refunded under TikTok's refund without return policy (the seller is not responsible).​ - COFUNDED_CREATOR_REWARDS: Fees charged for joining the co-funded creator rewards program to reward creator activities.​ ​ Logistics-related adjustments​ - FBT_WAREHOUSE_SERVICE_FEE: Amount charged by TikTok Fulfillment Portal (Pipak) for warehousing-related bills incurred by the seller under the Fulfilled by TikTok (FBT) service.​ - LOGISTICS_REIMBURSEMENT: Reimbursement paid by TikTok Shop for an order refunded due to logistics-related issues (e.g. lost or damaged order).​ - SHIPPING_FEE_ADJUSTMENT: Adjustment when there are differences or mistakes with the shipping fee paid by the seller.​ - SHIPPING_FEE_COMPENSATION: Compensation given to sellers due to differences between the actual shipping fee and the pre-paid shipping fee.​ - SHIPPING_FEE_REBATE: Shipping fee rebate provided to the seller as part of their participation in a platform campaign.​ - SAMPLE_SHIPPING_FEE: Fees charged for sending samples using the TikTok logistics provider.​ - SELLER_MISSION_REWARD: Platform provided cash reward for seller mission completion.​ ​ Miscellaneous adjustments​ OTHER_ADJUSTMENT: Adjustment for other reasons.​
The order ID.​ Each transaction can only be associated with an order ID or an adjustment ID.​
The creation time of the order. Unix timestamp.​
The adjustment ID if the transaction is an adjustment.​ Each transaction can only be associated with an order ID or an adjustment ID.​
The order ID associated with the adjustment, if any.​
The adjustment amount based on TikTok Shop policy. ​ Refer to transactions.type for the list of adjustment-related policies.​
The settlement amount for the order.​ ​ Formula: revenue_amount - shipping_cost_amount - fee_tax_amount - adjustment_amount​
The revenue amount at the time of order settlement. This is equivalent to the sum of all amounts in revenue_breakdown.​
The list of amounts that directly contribute to revenue_amount.​
The total price of all order items before any seller discounts and platform discounts are deducted. This is equivalent to the shop's gross sales.​
The total price of all refunded items before any seller discounts. This is equivalent to the shop's gross sales refund.​

The total amount of discounts funded by the seller, including:​ - Seller promotions (Product Discount, Flash Deal, Buy More Save More, Voucher and Bundle Deal)​ - Seller's portion of a co-funded voucher discount in co-funding campaigns​ - Seller discounts during a campaign​
Discounts returned to the sellers due to returns or refunds.​
The cash on delivery service fees charged to buyers.​ Applicable only for Saudi Arabia.​
The refund for cash on delivery service fees.​ Applicable only for Saudi Arabia.​
The shipping costs at the time of order settlement. This is equivalent to the sum of all contributory amounts in shipping_cost_breakdown.​
The list of amounts that directly contribute to shipping_cost_amount.​
The actual shipping fee calculated based on the weight/dimensions measured by the carrier. For details, check shipping_cost_breakdown.supplementary_component.​

The shipping fee subsidies and incentives provided by the platform. This includes all subsidies regardless of fulfillment channels or policies. For details, check shipping_cost_breakdown.supplementary_component.​
The actual shipping fee borne by the customer, calculated based on the product weight uploaded by the seller. Negative numbers refer to the refunded amount of customer-paid shipping fees​
The shipping fee paid by the seller for the delivery of returns.​
The shipping fee paid by the seller for the delivery of goods replacement.​ ​ Applicable only for Indonesia.​
The shipping fee paid by the seller for the delivery of goods exchange.​ ​ Applicable only for Indonesia.​
The fee incurred for packages requiring signature confirmation services.​
The shipping insurance fee incurred by the seller for purchasing additional TikTok shipping insurance services.​
Supplementary costs for your reference. These amounts do not directly contribute to shipping_cost_amount.​
The shipping fee discount provided in accordance with a campaign policy. This is part of shipping_fee_discount_amount.​

The additional shipping incentive that the seller will receive if the seller signed up for the Co-Funded Free Shipping Program. A negative amount indicates a reversal of incentives due to order refunds attributed to the seller's responsibility. This is part of shipping_fee_discount_amount.​

The shipping fee subsidy funded by the platform for seller shipping. This is part of shipping_fee_discount_amount.​ - Positive amount represents a subsidy received by the seller.​ - Negative amount represents a subsidy that the seller must return to TikTok Shop.​
The shipping fee discount provided by sellers.​
The fee to offset TikTok Shop Shipping Incentive or customer-paid shipping fee, resulting in a net charge of $0 to the seller.​ ​ Applicable only for the US.​
The shipping fee incurred by the seller for using TikTok Shipping. This is part of actual_shipping_fee_amount.​
The shipping fee incurred by the seller for orders fulfilled by TikTok (FBT). This is part of actual_shipping_fee_amount.​ ​ Applicable only for EU and UK.​
The shipping and warehouse fulfillment fee incurred by the seller for orders fulfilled by TikTok (FBT). This is part of actual_shipping_fee_amount.​ ​ Applicable only for the US.​
A reimbursement from TikTok Shop for Fulfilled by TikTok (FBT) orders that don't qualify for free shipping.​ Applicable only for the US.​
The fee borne by the customer to cover the cost of return labels. This fee is collected on the seller's behalf and settled according to the agreed payment terms.​
The total fees and taxes charged by TikTok Shop at the time of order settlement. Shipping-related costs are excluded. This is equivalent to the sum of all contributory amounts in fee_tax_breakdown. ​
The list of amounts that directly contribute to fee_tax_amount.​
The list of fees.​
The commission amount charged by the platform.​
The referral fee charged for processing successful orders.​ ​ Applicable only for the US. ​
The 20% refund administration fee deducted from the total refunded referral fee amount.​
The transaction fee charged for processing successful orders.​
The handling fee charged when the buyer pays with a credit card.​
The commission amount charged to the seller for payment to the creator.​
The affiliate ads commission paid to a creator before any personal income tax withholding.​ ​ Applicable only for SEA markets.​
The commission amount for purchases through affiliate partner links.​
The commission for eligible orders from ads.​
The service fee charged for participation in the [Seller Free Shipping Programme].​
The service fee charged for participation in the [LIVE Specials Programme].​
The service fee charged for participation in the bonus cashback program.​
The service fee charged for using TikTok Shop Mall.​
The service fee charged for participation in the Voucher Xtra program.​
The service fee charged for participation in flash sales.​
The service fee charged for co-funded promotions.​
The service fee charged for participation in the pre-order program.​
The commission amount charged by TikTok Shop Partners (TSP).​
The handling fee charged for orders that are fulfilled by Dilayani Tokopedia.​
The eco-contributions TikTok Shop pays on your behalf to the qualified producer responsibility organization (PRO).​
The handling fee charged to the seller for participation in the PayLater program.​
The fee charged to sellers by the platform for each item sold. This is equivalent to the sum of all per-item fees for all SKUs in the order.​ Applicable only for the Brazil market.​
The portion of the creator bonus that you co-fund as part of the commission boost campaign.​
The dynamic commission fee is the amount that the platform charges to all sellers for every successfully delivered order.​ Applicable only for Indonesia.​
The list of tax amounts.​
The VAT paid by the platform on the seller's behalf. ​ ​ Applicable only for cross-border shop orders.​
The import VAT, a tax paid on goods bought in one country and imported into another. ​ Applicable only for cross-border shop orders. In Japan, it refers to the Japan Consumption Tax (JCT).​
The customs duties, a type of tax on cross-border goods collected by governments. ​ ​ Applicable only for cross-border shop orders.​
The fees charged by logistic suppliers for customs clearance services. ​ ​ Applicable only for cross-border shop orders.​
The sales and service tax (SST) collected and remitted to the tax authority by the platform for low-value goods imported into Malaysia, effective January 1, 2024.​
The goods and services tax (GST) collected and remitted to the tax authority by the platform for low-value goods imported into Singapore, effective January 1, 2023. ​
The Mexican VAT that TikTok Shop is required to withhold on your taxable products and remit to the tax authority.​
The Mexican federal income tax that TikTok Shop is required to withhold.​
The anti-dumping duties collected by governments for import goods.​
The VAT paid by the platform on the seller's behalf. Applicable only for local shop orders.​
The personal income tax (PIT) paid by the platform on the seller's behalf.​
Supplementary costs for your reference. These amounts do not directly contribute to the settlement amount.​
The total amount paid by the customer.​
The exact amount refunded to the customer.​
The discounts funded by the platform, such as coupons and campaign discounts.​
The platform discounts to be reversed (and deducted from the final settlement) if the order was refunded as a result of the seller's responsibility.​
The seller's portion of a co-funded voucher discount in co-funding campaigns.​
The seller's portion of a co-funded voucher discount in co-funding campaigns that was refunded to the seller.​
The platform's portion of a co-funded voucher discount in co-funding campaigns.​
The platform's portion of a co-funded voucher discount in co-funding campaigns that was refunded to the platform.​
The final retail delivery fee for deliveries in Colorado, US. For more information, see Colorado Retail Delivery Fee FAQ.​ ​ ​ Formula: retail_delivery_fee_payment + retail_delivery_fee_refund​
The retail delivery fee for deliveries in Colorado, US. For more information, see Colorado Retail Delivery Fee FAQ.​
The retail delivery fee subsidy by the platform for losses due to returns, refunds, or other issues in Colorado, US.​
The final sales tax to be paid by the customer for the product and delivery. ​ ​ Formula: sales_tax_payment_amount - sales_tax_refund_amount​
The expected sales tax to be paid by the customer for the product and delivery.​
The sales tax amount returned to the customer in the event of a refund.​
The ID of a reserve transaction.​

The amount withheld from settlement based on TikTok Shop Reserve Policy. Refer to TikTok Shop Academy for more information.​ - A positive amount indicates funds that have been released.​ - A negative amount indicates funds being withheld from the settlement.​
The order ID associated with the reserve transaction.​

The status of the reserve funds.​ Possible values:​ - COLLECTED: A portion of the order's settlement amount has been withheld as reserve funds.​ - RELEASED: The previously reserved funds have been released and paid out to the seller.​
The estimated date when the reserve funds will be released and paid out to the seller. Unix timestamp. ​ Returns an empty value if the reserve funds have already been released.​
